sense.name: form or compose
sense.examples: These constitute my entire belongings. What constitutes the Holy Grail for some is just business as usual for others. This report constitutes the proceedings of the Fifteenth Text Retrieval Conference. The Wall, Forts, and associated structures together constituted the Roman Frontier.

sense.name: set up, establish
sense.examples: They would respectfully ask to be constituted the Medical Department of the university. To achieve those goals, IOM constituted the Committee for the Workshop on the Medicolegal Death Investigation System.

sense.name: appoint
sense.examples: About the same time he was constituted warden of all the king's forests. He was constituted 5 March 1784 one of the lords commissioners of trade and plantations. The General Conference of 1872 constituted her a member of the board of managers of the Ladies and Pastors' Christian Union.
